ostrowski

Class OstrowskiAutomaton

  • java.lang.Object
    • dk.brics.automaton.Automaton
      • ostrowski.OstrowskiAutomaton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Alg0Automaton, Alg1Automaton, Alg2Automaton, Alg3Automaton, RecognitionAutomaton

    abstract class OstrowskiAutomaton
extends Automaton
    The ostrowski automaton base class. Explanation for Input range: The range of the input might vary based on the position of the input. For example, in recognition automaton for rt3 Ostrowski numeration system, the first input can range from 0 to 1, the second can range from 0 to 2, the third can range from 0 to 1, etc.. In this case, the inputRange would be {{1},{2}}, the maxInputRange would be {2}, and the repeatBeginIndex would be 0. For another example, in algorithm 1 of addition automaton for an Ostrowski numeration system with continuous fraction [5,1,2;3,4] with [3,4] being the repeating part, Then range={{10,5},{2,1},{4,2},{6,3},{8,4}}, nonRepeatLength = 3, totalLength=5, maxInputRange = {10,5}. Alg1Automaton({{10,5},{2,1},{4,2},{6,3},{8,4}},3) will construct an instance of said alg1.

    • Field Detail

      • DEBUG

        static final boolean DEBUG
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • initialStates

        private java.util.Set<State> initialStates
        The set of initialStates. Only used during the construction of the automaton. After invoking configureInitialStates(), this becomes irrelevant.

      • maxInputRange

        int[] maxInputRange
        The maximum range of each input. See class description for more detail.

      • nonRepeatLength

        int nonRepeatLength
        The length of the non-repeated part of the range. See class description for more detail.

      • range

        final int[][] range
        The max of each input in different positions. Least significant digit first. See class description for more detail.

      • states

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,State> states
        A temporary dictionary that maps state encoding to states. Only used during the construction of the automaton. After invoking restoreInvariant(), this becomes irrelevant. Key is the encoding of the state. Value is the corresponding state.

      • totalLength

        int totalLength
        TotalLength of range Must be equal to range.length
